scope_of_work.problem: After fire and sprinkler system activation on 04/01/2025 it was found that the Pre-Action Sprinkler pipe work has rusted in places and requires replacement. Pre-Action Sprinkler system in the ground floor and first floor machine room is currently isolated due to this fault.
scope_of_work.scope: To replace section of rusted sprinkler pipe work in first floor office area.
scope_of_work.justification: This works is required to bring Pre-Action Sprinkler systems back online
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: The Pre-Action Sprinkler systems will remain offline with no coverage in the machine room areas.

project_name: UPM-DRUPS Loadbank Provision for April OEM Major Service and Load Run
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Roberta Wilkinson (2):work order closed by Miss Maymie Sporer (3):work commencement by Jayme Feil (4):work planning by Miss Maymie Sporer (5):offer approved (6):offer submitted by Jayme Feil (7):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes: Validity 30 days. Need to secure delivery for DRUPS service date 14th 15th April.
scope_of_work.problem: DRUPS is due it's next quarterly load run at >35% load on the April 2025 OEM major service as per best practice. Current business load does not provide enough load so the hire of a 600kW load bank is required.
scope_of_work.scope: Hire and connection, disconnection of 600kW load bank with inline 1250A MCCB issue of PTWs/ICs Delivery of load bank.
scope_of_work.justification: Current business load does not provide enough load so the hire of a 600kW load bank is required. Running => 35% load for 1 hour ensures all air is removed from the fuel circuit as during the service the fuel filter is replaced. Operating with suitable load and engine temperature also prevents a wet stacking condition that leads to engine exhaust deposit build up.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Please see justification. Load run regime increases machine reliability.

project_name: UPM-Phase 1A Critical Chilled Water Pumps Overhaul
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Roberta Wilkinson (2):work order closed by Miss Maymie Sporer (3):work commencement by Jayme Feil (4):work planning by Miss Maymie Sporer (5):offer approved (6):offer submitted by Jayme Feil (7):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes: This fixed cost offer is based on suction and discharge valves holding during each overhaul and no other unforeseen problem occurring.
scope_of_work.problem: Ph1A DC is supported by 3 critical primary chilled water pumps, 2 duty 1 standby (N+1). Pump 3 is operating noisily and has been moved to standby as a precaution, thus still available if required N+1. On investigation with specialist the pump requires an overhaul as per scope of works below. On checking Pump 1, it also has an operating noise indicating deterioration thus the recommendation is to overhaul all three pumps as they are all the same age (2004).
scope_of_work.scope: Isolate pump 3 mechanically via valves and electrically.Remove motor from pumpDismantle motor on siteSupply and fit new bearings and sealsSupply and ft new gasketsSupply and fit new lip sealReassemble motorFit motor into positionConfirm correct operationRe-sequence pumps as required and repeat above for pumps 1 and 2
scope_of_work.justification: The pumps deliver chilled water to CSD and CSC to maintain the environment to the correct temperature.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increased risk of total pump failure.

project_name: UPM-Liver Building Audio Visual Survey Proposal
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Miss Maymie Sporer

scope_of_work.notes: This price is to cover a survey only and will provide a report so that follow up actions can be put together as part of client requestFollow up actions are to be funded via a separate piece of work covered by a separate offer
scope_of_work.problem: This proposal involves a comprehensive evaluation and documentation process conducted by a AV engineer. The initial task is for the engineer to visit the Liver Building, Liverpool site to inspect the existing AV equipment and setup. This inspection aims to assess the current state, functionality, and integration of the AV systems within the rooms.
scope_of_work.scope: This inspection aims to assess the current state, functionality, and integration of the AV systems within the rooms. After completing the on-site inspection, the engineer will compile a detailed report based on their findings. The report will cover aspects such as the performance of the equipment and any potential issues discovered. The engineer will also note any outdated or non-functional components that require attention.The final report will be delivered to CBRE, offering them a comprehensive overview of the AV estate in the Liver building on the Second Floor (Kyndryl Space). This feedback will prove invaluable in planning future upgrades, maintenance, and ensuring optimal operation of the AV assets.
scope_of_work.justification: This will enable Kyndryl to understand the current AV within the Liver Building Second Floor (Kyndryl Space) and will provide a report to detail the existing set up and what is required to upgrade as required
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: A Survey will not be able to be complete and the AV systems may not be accessible, working on day 1 of building usage on behalf of Kyndryl

project_name: UPM-DRUPS 4 Fuel Tank Polish and Clean
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Neil Hauck (2):offer submitted by Neil Hauck (3):sor submitted / draft by Neil Hauck

scope_of_work.notes: Quote valid for 30 days SDM to carry out works on receipt of PO
scope_of_work.problem: During routine sampling of fuel it was found that DRUPS 4 fuel is contaminated and requires remedial action.
scope_of_work.scope: To remove all fuel from DRUPS 4 tank and carry out a maned entry clean. recover re usable fuel and return it to tank post clean. (fuel to be topped up post works)
scope_of_work.justification: dirty fuel being used in DRUPS tank could effect the running of the machine and put business load at risk
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: risk of contaminated fuel could be used through DRUPS and cause damage to the engine
